Name: Srinidhi Rao
Title: Old city charms and perils
Review: Heard that it was a good place for shopping as well as street food. True that the shops are cheaper than those is Hazratgang and not so fancy. You will need to search for good bargains in the lanes. Do not take a car there. Go to the closest area and hire an electric tuk tuk.  The oldest Tunday Kebab outlet is there which is in a narrow lane full of motorbikes going to and fro. Quite an adventure to reach that place.

Name: flyingwish
Title: See Chaos of Old Lucknow
Review: Visit chowk to see the real old Lucknow chaos of people and vehicles. Also, the famous Idris biryani is located here. Unfortunately it was closed for renovations.

Name: Vidhata bache
Title: crowded, unhygienic, nontasty
Review: Its just another bazaar street with humans, cows, dogs, unauthorised vendors, filth, no footpath, flyover, crowded market, unhygienic food, non tasty food. Avoid.

Name: Stuti Das
Title: A foodies paradise- must visit for Makkhan Malai and Poori sabzi
Review: When in Lucknow, do what the nawabs would do. Hop on a rickshaw or a tonga (if you can get one from the rumi darwaza gate) and explore the old city. Do make a trip in the morning if you want to gorge on the best dessert ever made- Makhhan Malai. Available near the Chowk Chauraha (very close to KGMC), you will see a row of stalls selling this delectable dessert. Prices start at Rs 60 for 100 gm and do drop in at Gaya Prasad Makkhan Malai stall (near Paramapara sweet shop). Packing is also available in case you want to savour it at home. Also you can gorge on to some sumptuous poori and sabzi from sevak ram ki dukan (over 100 years old shop). Ask for directions from proprietor at Gaya Prasad stall. While at Sevak Ram you can also treat yourself to Black Carrot ka halwa (600 rupees kg) and it is out of this world. Also available are samosas and jalebis and khasta kachori.

Name: Ashwin
Title: Excellent shopping destination !!
Review: Enjoyed the shopping as the difference in rates from other marked is huge!!Range of material and choice is unbelievable. Really good!!

Name: John Muriango
Title: Amazing.
Review: Staff were amazing. Service was great. The taste was excellent. Ambience is top notch. I can't get enough of this place. Highly recommended.

Name: VIPIN_GOEL_TP_Impex
Title: Bought Lucknow Chikan Cloths
Review: Once in Lucknow, it is always tempting to buy world famous Chikan Cloths. So search for cheap and best takes us to Chowk Market. Travelled in a E-rickshaw for more than 40 minutes from Odeon Cinema to reach here. Lots of shops are there. Do not forget to bargain.

Name: Arun Sarna
Title: Tempting aromatic food
Review: crowed place filled with aroma.... tempting food all around..if you want good chat try at Parampara, & if unique authentic malai Makhan try at any of the vendor standing at chowk

Name: AnupamSharan
Title: Gol Darwaza to Akbar Gate food walk
Review: A culinary experience to walk in this street, and sample the Nihari Kulcha , Pink Kashmiri Tea, Tilgoza sweets, fluffy ice cream malai makhan and excellent paans. Ignore the dirty streets .

Name: DrKlair
Title: Excellent food and old Ambience
Review: Walk through from Akbari gate to Gol Darwaza through the really narrow lanes and by lanes of the old city sampling the food . Please note that the houses are so close and lanes covered that google maps sometimes fails .Do take a guide.

Name: GRVARCH
Title: A good market for food and shopping lovers.
Review: This is a good attraction in Lucknow.This is  a good market for food and shopping lovers.Many showrooms for Chicken embroidery work which is identity of Lucknow.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Foodies Delight
Review: Everywhere around are tempting places to eat  that have had made Lucknow  mecca of foodies .Walk through lanes and by lanes that smack of times gone by of Awadh of yore , albeit in decay .

Name: Anuradha
Title: A crowded Chowk
Review: A very crowded place with old shops and a variety of retail shopping and food. Makhan malai in winters is a must have dessert, which is just equivalent to Delhi‚Äôs Daulat ki chaat but a little heavier than that.

Name: Anupriya Singh
Title: Good place for shopping and eating
Review: We visited Chowk for shopping some local chikan work clothes. The area is full of shops that sell good quality chikan work at reasonable rates. The place is crowded and not suitable for taking kids along for peaceful shopping. Do not miss the makkhan Malai sold here during the winters.

Name: Rakesh
Title: A must visit place in Lucknow
Review: For better experience of city this is must visit place. Try malai makhan on the street. You will feel like haven fall on your feet.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Enjoyed
Review: Enjoyed a lot here food is amazing here . For shopping also this place is good . Bought many things from here.

Name: niya27
Title: Old Lucknow area
Review: I visited Chowk for bada imambada. There are many other attractions in the same area. I also enjoyed stree food here.

Name: engineertripster
Title: It's a good place for shopping and eating
Review: It's one of the shopping areas in Lucknow. It has many shops selling different types of Chikan embroidery. You will also find many shops selling zari designs as well.In addition, there are many restaurants around. The one thing we enjoyed the most was the Malai Makhan(we went during the winter season). It is soft and creamy and is sold around the market. It's a must-try.

Name: ShikshaC
Title: Bustling market‚Ä¶
Review: Chowk is a bustling market area near Lucknow‚Äòs attractions. It has several shops where you can buy a variety of items from chikan work to jewellery to food items. The famous makhan malai can also be found here during winters and is a must try item.

Name: Sanpreet Johar
Title: Best place of lucknow
Review: Best place for chillll with family nd friends  and chicken is faMous of this place and the place follow the old traditional form of lucknowüòäüôèüëçüëå

Name: Let's Go Sightseeing
Title: Eating & shopping
Review: It's not just heritage structures that lend an appeal to a place. It's also the traditional markets, cuisines, & culture... & Chowk contributes majorly to Lucknow's history! This market area is heaven for foodies & shoppers. The best way to get around is on foot...& don't hesitate to explore the tiny gullies! Seek out Phool Wali Gali. The flower mandi is 200-year-old... If I close my eyes now, I can still remember the fragrance!

Name: misiddiqui2017
Title: Central and Crowded
Review: Chowk is as good as it has always been. It's a paradise for shoppers and foodies! But the crowd there is a deterrent for anyone not used to it! It happened to be Dushera's time as well!

Name: Pravesh Goswami
Title: Heritage...
Review: The gateway of old lucknow. Lot of options for food & shopping. Pls come here with ample time to explore.

Name: taotzu
Title: A lovely area for Street food
Review: A local traditional area for Street food as well as good restaurants & sweet shops. Nearby is a market for a traditional handicraft on cloth chikankari. It's a bustling area. A must-visit.

Name: Christopher B
Title: A Must Visit to get a Taste Of Traditional life
Review: I visited Chowk looking for jeri-work on cloth craftsmen and found wonderful craftsmanship in the hands of women!

Name: Maria
Title: Heart of Lucknow!
Review: Chowk- Old Lucknow, is definitely the heart of Lucknow. Old building, historic monuments, the hustle and bustle of this place is something you cannot ignore. Some of the most authentic eateries and shops can be found in this place.

Name: Getaway46933868548
Title: its the heart of lucknow
Review: here you see what lucknow is all about.u can sense and feel the nawabi era.with mouth watering dishes, narrow lanes and big hearts , a place to visit.eat makkan malai, buy good clothes, visit oldest tundey kababi and rahim's nahari kulche.and dont forget to visit nakkhas .

Name: sawhneysaab
Title: Must visit
Review: Kind of a must visit place when you're going to lucknow - experience the restaurants, crowds and rickshaws.

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: Great Food
Review: I am big foody. Chowk is really only for food lovers. Amazing taste and great quality at affordable price.

Name: mehtarakeshkumar56
Title: eating point
Review: the chowk in lucknow is famous for its road side eateries . local food include chat , golgape , pakoda , kulfi falooda . its an crowded place , but best place to enjoy who like eating a lot.

Name: S P S
Title: Golden area of old Lucknow
Review: It is a place to see art work on fabric, chikenkari, delicious foods, thandai and culture of Nawabs at old Lucknow

Name: canpush
Title: Food plaza
Review: Chowk area near Aminabad chowk is full of eateries. Many good eateries are around providing variety of food. Particularly good was Tooday Kababi who provided great kababs.

Name: TRAVELANE_SHANTANU
Title: Chowk, Lucknow
Review: Chowk is a popular market in central Lucknow, located about three km from Bara Imambara. One of the oldest markets in the city, it comprises of inter-connected narrow streets, with small shops selling chikan garments, ittar and ornaments. The market still maintains its old charm and is best for buying chikankari cloths and antique items. You can shop for quality chikan embroidered materials as it is the hub of chikan garment manufacturers.Market is closed on ThursdayChowk market has more than 5000 shops spread around the narrow, labyrinthine cobweb of streets on both sides and sometimes taking much of the road itself. In these quaint shops, both bricked shops as well as temporary ones, you will find authentic chikankari and zardozi dresses, traditional handmade jewelleries, handcrafted home d√©cor items from wood, bamboo and ivory, nagara shoes, ittar or perfume made from essence of real flowers, and innumerable other small and big items, in varieties beyond your imagination.Other than these, to soothe your tingling culinary senses, there are a handful of shops selling authentic Awadhi food - kebabs, biriyanis, paratha with chicken or mutton and milk products as well. A one day trip to the Chowk market means a true exploration of how Lucknow looks, feels and sounds like.The tourist spot of Imambara and Bhool Bhulaiya are nearby. You can include a visit to the Chowk with these places and take a day off your usual motor-run vehicles and taste the flavour of past.

Name: Rudra Sharma
Title: Enjoy the Original Lucknowi andaj.....
Review: Chowk is the center place of Lucknow. It is the biggest and very old market place where you will find any item, whether it is traditional item or the latest one. Lakhnawi chicken (both food and clothing) are available at their best at this place. If you enter the chicken garment area, you will find hundreds of shops spread in multiple numbers of buildings here. The quality and the rate both we found reasonable, but bargaining is a must in this market.But the main attraction of Chowk is its food variety. Besides the non-veg items, you will get very good quality vegetarian foods. We tasted a typical sweet called Malai gola. It is made of foam of butter. The taste was really very good, Besides this, we tasted hot milk mixed with saffron (kesar). This is also a speciality of chowk area.

Name: ASHISH V
Title: Must place to visit in lucknow
Review: If you are planning to visit lucknow. Must visit this place for shopping and for the food. Must visit destination in lucknow.

Name: somesh.nath
Title: Home to finest Awadhi Chikankari
Review: A trip to Lucknow can never be complete unless you have visited Chow. Primarily the market is defined by narrow lanes and myriad of shops selling, Chikan (Cloths), antiques, embroidery and jewelry for all occasions. You can shop till you drop for the whole day. The best way to commute is to walk  around or take a Rick saw or at best a two wheeler. Car and Auto 3 wheels add to the traffic congestion. With plenty of eating joints and street food vendors Chowk offers mouth watering Kebabs, Malai Makhan and Badam Shakes in order to satisfy the hungry.

Name: BlrTravR
Title: Shopping
Review: Good place to experience the old parts of the city - crowded with shops, cycle rickshaws, vehicles and street food vendors.

Name: Sharil I
Title: Shopaholic Ring
Review: Ring is what Chowk means. Thus this place adores people who want to go on a shopping spree of Lucknawi chikan materials and clothing with the addition of good Veg and Non-veg delicacies.

Name: Niraj K
Title: OLD LUCKNOW
Review: If one is interested to eat specialties of Lucknow then he must go to Chowk. If you has not tasted the Makkhan Malai at the main gate of Chowk and Nearby Raja ki Thandai or Paan and Lassi you will repent life time

Name: Puja_deb
Title: Must visit
Review: Great place for chikankari shopping at reasonable price. Dont miss the makkhan malai during winter. Rahim ki Nihari & Idris ki biryani are must have when in Chowk

Name: raj kamal singh
Title: Me and my STOMACH
Review: Dear if you want to taste the traditional dishes of Lucknow then this would be the right place to visit. From veg to non veg all is there, but believe me i love the non veg. Do visit if you are hungry.Religious people for you all there is Temple of Goddess Kaali ji which is also very old and has many faiths and believes.

Name: Sweetbunnycute
Title: Very crowded place just like Delhi‚Äôs Chandani Chowk
Review: It is the oldest market in Lucknow and hence really really crowded place. Although I went there only to visit and taste the original Tundaye Kebabi‚Äôs Kebabs. But I would not suggest anyone to go there unless you have a real craze for originality. In order to reach the outlet it took a lot of effort as the streets were really congested with heavy traffic and people.

Name: Abhinav D
Title: Shaan of Lucknow
Review: Anyone visiting lucknow & not visiting Chowk will never get to know what real lko is !This place specialises in its food, Market,Chikan clothes & Ittar perfumes & a lot of such items !Over all a must visit !

Name: vipulagrawal1
Title: Lots of Breakfast options.
Review: In winters Chowk is good for Makkhan Malai which is a sweet delicacy and very popular in Lucknow. There are many good sweet shops for Khasta, Jalebi etc. It's morning paradise for foodies

Name: Aman Agarwal
Title: Badiya
Review: If u wanna enjoy some tasty üòã  food then this place is for you . U will get amazing kebab , chole bhature , puri sabzi , and much more..

Name: Amit7488
Title: Old Lucknow
Review: Uncountable small n big shops of chikan clothes, at Gol dawaza you will find many tiny stalls selling ‚Äúmakhan‚Äù the special traditional sweet of Lucknow..If You like to buy chikan in lessor rates..this place has worth to visit

Name: Vipul K
Title: See real Lucknow here
Review: See two distinct faces of Lucknow- Gol Darwaza separates the two. Stroll Chowk area which satiates all senses quite literally. Great food, skill fully made local clothes, perfumes etc. Try original tundey kebabs just 300 m from Gol Darwaza. If biryani is your calling visit Idrees biryani shop about 1 km from Chowk.

Name: lalani_13
Title: Nice shops!
Review: we went there with our driver and bought some chiffon chikan kurti and the price was very good. Then our driver took us for other sight seeings.

Name: milesnmeals
Title: Up and close with true Lucknow
Review: We went there to reach out to the famous eateries, and RAm Asrey Sweetshop. One can shop for perfumes, sweets, and eat  a hearty meal. Not expensive, but pls beware of your belongings at is crowded and low on lihts

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Chowk
Review: Chowk is the old city area of Lucknow. This place is full of hustle bustle and numerous good food joints.

Name: saurabh k
Title: Must visit you are food lover
Review: This place is famous for food,here you will find variety of local receipies especially biryani.If you are food lover you must visit this place.üòÅüòÅüòÅIf anything gone wrong don't panic KGMC is just few step ahead. üòÄüòÄüòÄ

Name: abhinavsaxena11
Title: Original flavour of Lucknow
Review: Original city flavours where you get everything, chats , makhan, chole bhature at shree, tunday kebabi, chicken karigari work on kurta with different price range..must have. If you‚Äôre visiting Lucknow then you must visit the market.

Name: AshisGhatak
Title: Busy place
Review: A visit to this place is a must to get a flavour of local culture and local food. One can get cheap Chikan shops too. But one must enjoy the crowd to be there.

Name: Nishesh K
Title: variety of foods and clothes
Review: If u want to have delicious makkhan which melts in mouth, or want to buy chikan dress for ur loved ones. CHOWK is the best place

Name: Vivek P
Title: Old Lucknow
Review: Culture of Old Lucknow, Biryani are very famous here. Must visit Place.Its a kind of Heart, you will get all the necessary big brands showroom here with good food market.

Name: Prashant K
Title: Chowk - Core of Lucknowi Tehzeeb
Review: This is the place for people looking for authentic Chikankari work and some of the most delicacies both for veg & non-veg lovers

Name: himanshulko
Title: Lucknow Foodies
Review: One of the best food in lucknow (during Oct - march). Chowk is always famous for its delicacies food. If tourist visit India-Uttar Pradesh-Lucknow-Chowk, then he/she must get good food to eat.

Name: Rishi B
Title: Foodies Paradise with history of Lucknow
Review: The best place to be in Lucknow for tasting all the delicacy Lucknow is famous for...Be it veg or non veg or chaat or makkhan malai...It also has famous historical monuments by which Lucknow is recognized...Rumi Darwaza and Ghanta ghar....All the authentic Lucknow made chickan clothes are made and sold here...

Name: KALKI
Title: Chowk restaurant
Review: Chowk is a great hotel in Lucknow,but it is small in size.taste was nice.south indians also like the taste of chowk.

Name: Bobby J
Title: Chowk market of lucknow
Review: Chowk market in Lucknow is one of those places of the city that are a window into its rich cultural heritage. Beginning from Chikan work to succulent kebabs, one can find it all at the Chowk market.

Name: Clara S
Title: "Busy Shopping Street*
Review: It's a great place for shopping. If you are looking for the famous chicken work clothing, this is the place. We found more variety and reasonably priced compared to other markets...

Name: NouvelleTraveller
Title: Excellent for Shopping!
Review: Chowk has shops selling the best and most affordable chikankari clothes. I would recommend Saraswati Chikan and PV Chikan. Wholesale rates and wide variety. Bit crowded but if you've been to Chandni Chowk in Delhi, you know how to manuver. Card and cash both work in shops, but take cash preferably.

Name: Amit M
Title: Experience Lucknawi Andaaz
Review: The real feeling of traditional Lucknow only be observed when in Chowk. Old congested market but very famous for traditional Chicken dresses; real taste of authentic sweets, kite flying and Lucknawi Paan.A must visit for tradition lovers.

Name: sanjeev05
Title: place to get the feel of old city
Review: its for those who want to explore places. Those who avoid crowds, pleased dont visit. Here one can get many chikan shops, food joints, the essence of lucknow

Name: Manish2618
Title: Tasty
Review: The place was so nice and there was so much of people which makes me to attract me having fun there and ate so much tasty food

Name: Syed K
Title: A must visit for Foodies
Review: Lucknow is the city for Foodies. It has its very own unique taste of mughalai dishes which you will find only and only in Lucknow. Chowk has so many unknown shops which are not famous but has better taste than any other city

Name: Gaurav C
Title: crowded old part of the city...
Review: Chowk is the old part of the city adorned with historical places....you have to brave the crowds to enjoy it...numerous places to eat and dine....you get the awesome makhan malai in the winters...chickankari suits...and a lot more places for kababs....its like the old delhi...

Name: Rohit T
Title: Lucknow's tradition
Review: Chowk is still the traditional spot of Lucknow. In winters visit the Chowk chauraha to have Makkhan malai and a cup of tea. In summers have thandai there. Besides many eateries and sweet shops , go shopping for chikan work. Places to visit nearby - chota and bada Imambara, Clock Tower

Name: Kaustav Datta üçÅ
Title: Experience Old Lucknow
Review: Best place to experience old lucknow and its charm. Crowded and lot of walking needed. The place is filled with Chikan showrooms and delicious old town eateries. The best you'll have in Lucknow. A must visit for sure.

Name: Arvind Kaur Jain
Title: Amazing place for Chikankari Fans!
Review: If you have a flare for chikankari, this is a mecca for you... You will find amazing chikankari suits, dupattas and running fabric here... from cotton to georgettes, this place has all... Everything is very economical and a great place to taste the vibes of Lukhnow...

Name: mak_mshr
Title: Historical place
Review: Chowk is a good place for visit all historical monuments are near around the chowk, it is also the hub for pure awadhi food like tundey kababi, Irish, alamgir are well known non veg food joints, Milk product like Kesariya doodh ,pandit Raja ki thandai is there It also the hub of chicken art on clothes so you can do shopping there, the problem is only big traffic jam especially the streets and Nakhas road.

Name: Niya1315
Title: Old Lucknow
Review: This place is famous among food lovers. The place is also very crowded. Some old monuments of Lucknow is also near to this place. You can buy chicken suits here at a reasonable price.

Name: karan a
Title: Food lovers must visit!!
Review: A nust visit place for all foodies out there!!You will get a wonderful variety of food and that is economical too!!You will enjoy a great variety of tasty and healthy food.

Name: hreela
Title: you must have much time.
Review: I never prefer this place to move around. so conjugated, too rush,y place, but good for Non Veg Lovers, fortunately I am pure veg :)

Name: nitin m
Title: Old place for shopping
Review: This place is in old Lucknow and very famous for shopping of local Chikan clothes. Also has many shops selling famous sweets of Lucknow

Name: TAMOJIT2014
Title: cheap location
Review: many shops with whole sale rates, chikan materials, food shops and other items are also good, better than aminabad also in some cases

Name: Shivbalak
Title: Chowk
Review: It is a good market to go and have a walk..one can try the makkhan malai at the entry only..rajaji ki thandai..black gajar ka halwa inside the market just opposite to tunde kababi..and there are many more things to buy for families,kids..we visited it in the evening..so it was a good atmosphere at that time.

Name: Pradyumna M
Title: Quite crowded place
Review: Visited their multiple times and everything is available for good prices and mostly meat is easily available üçó so i like that place because near to it their is KGMU hospital too and that's a good area

Name: samyjamy
Title: CHowk
Review: CHowk is a good place to shop for authentic chikan Kari clothes. Here you will also find some good eateries to satisfy your taste buds.

Name: liferocks24
Title: the HEART of LUCKNOW
Review: Chowk is the place where the flavours of lucknow originate. this is the place  where one can find the lucknowi chikan clothing , the food , the traditiona land the cultural  feel of lucknow be it in language or the respect , attire ,the traffic ,the lanes, the tuk tuks..everything begins here. it is adjacent to RUMI Darwaza . the nearest landmark is the famous Raja thandai. to explore lucknow this is the place to begin with.

Name: smitagupta
Title: melt in the mouth.....
Review: a visit to Lucknow would be incomplete without a visit to the Chowk to have the absolutely divine " malai makhan or Nimish".... a dish to die for!!!!

Name: Aakash A
Title: Old Lucknow
Review: This place surely gives you feelings of old Lucknow. You can enjoy street -food here. If you get a time, please visit Idrees ki Biryani. They are famous for awesome non-veg. Please try Mutton Biryani and it was yummy.

Name: shahbaz h
Title: A monumental visit...
Review: I was alone and i decided to visit chowk which is famous for its monuments and non veg food. One of the famous monuments like Bara Imambara, Clock tower, Akbari gate, Roomi darwaja, Chota imambara, picture gallery etc... Were there and trust me that were awesome to me. Really i enjoyed a lot, than i visit chowk market, that was to big and cheap, and provides each and every kind of stuff for everyone. Real Tundey Kababi also there which is known for its delicious taste in the whole world. Apart from that i tried Kashmiri tea, Malai makkhan which was unforgettable to me. People were too supportive and kind hearted. Overall it was my one of the best visit. Thank you!

Name: Pawan Agnihotri
Title: Old Lucknow Charm
Review: You can easily say that it's the Chandni Chowk of Lucknow. Old Lucknow charm visible here to it's fullest. Good street food.

Name: Yogi
Title: The Old Charm
Review: This is what you expect out of an old city filled with heritage. The Chowk is about narrow streets and all kinds of shops. You can see a lot of locals coming out here for their shopping and stuff. The chowk is close to Imambara so it is easy to reach. One can find a lot of clothing outlets around with famous chiken work of Lucknow.

Name: gerry3f
Title: Best part of guided tour
Review: Without Arif our UP Tourism guide I would have never have got to see the hives of industry that are hidden away in the maze of alleys that make up Chowk. There was no pressure to buy in any of the establishments we visited although the textiles and perfume oils were tempting. We finished at the allegedly impossible to find Tunday for some delicious Galwati kebab.Unfortunately I did not have time to visit again before leaving Lucknow due to a cancelled train forcing me to re-schedule

Name: Dalbir_S_Virdi
Title: Couldnt Recognize the place
Review: I had visited Chowk way back in 1976 and obviously after 40+ years, things had completely changed. Its now a very crowded place with chaotic Traffic pouring in from all directions, unmanageable crowd, deafening noise of honking and roaring engines of vehicles and not to miss the pollution all around. This is definitely not the Chowk that I had in my memories. There are hundreds of Chikan shops here - the famous dress material of Lucknow. Arohi Complex in Chowk has maximum number of Shops. Chowk also boasts of traditional eateries of Lucknow. Here you can get best of the Kulfis, Makhan Malai (A must try) and mouth watering non veg preparations.

Name: Nikhil P
Title: Old world charm  of city of Nawabs
Review: If you want to have the feel of old world charm of lucknow, then Chowk is the place to be . The street food available over here is quite delicious and one will have a finger licking experience to remember for a long time. I personally liked desi ghee tikki.  One can also buy clothes , shoes over here .

Name: naveen_oberoi
Title: Feel Old Lucknow
Review: If you want to feel real Lucknow, the chowk is must visit. One can enjoy all the local food here. I went in the winters so got a chance to try a famous winter dish - Makhan Malai. This dish is only available for couple of months during winters. Best place to buy chicken hand work cloths from this chowk market.

Name: Manas R
Title: Chikan hub
Review: Crowded and poorly maintained traffic. But you should come here for getting a taste of old Lucknow, particularly if you have plan for shopping some chikan.

Name: shriyans b
Title: Makkhan
Review: I am from chowk lucknow and mainly the chowk is famous for chicken clothes dardogy, and for food.You can have makkhan malai, chole bhatoore, thandai, kachori and in clothing you can hve chicken kurtas for girls and boys and jhutti

Name: krishna831
Title: old city
Review: one of the oldest city of Lucknow.near this city river Gomti flowing. bda Imambara and medical college also very to this city.

Name: Rasheedur Rahman Shihab
Title: Old City
Review: Chowk is one of the places in the Old City of the City of Nawabs, Lucknow. I often visit this place to have amazing food.

Name: SrajantheCritic
Title: The Food Heaven of Lucknow
Review: To taste the best of delicacies of any city chowk is the place to visit.Same is the case with lucknow.Visit chowk to eat various awadhi delicacies especially Makhan Malia and Tunday Kebabetc.Anyone who comes to Lucknow and pay a visit to chowk and it's food centres.

Name: parusharouthud
Title: Chowk is near Bara Imambra in lucknow
Review: All visitors at chowk must taste Makkhan Malai.Though the cost of makhan malai is little high the taste is completely worth. The place is also famouse for food veg and non veg along with sweets.

Name: Daniel
Title: Makkhan Malai is to die for
Review: I visited chowk very early in the morning for Makkhan Malai and had it outside the Premji's sweet shop. Although I spent around Rs. 350 for travel, once I tasted the Makkhan Malai I felt it was completely worth it. At the end of the day, its just milk churned up to a foam with nuts, saffron but we can never manage it at home, so I had 3 of them. We did not shop around so I cannot comment on that.

Name: Sam3011
Title: Amazing Market place
Review: Your Lucknow visit is incomplete if you have not visited Chowk. Be it shopping for Chikankari dresses/saris or satisfying your taste buds. Chowk visit is must.

Name: Rick6d
Title: Chaotic but great nimish
Review: Seek out the numerous nimish sellers. Big mounds of sweet airy fragrant cream. With rosewater and saffron, plus nuts and silver. Lightest desert you'll ever have.

Name: HOMPRS
Title: Rustic
Review: Chowk is eating paradise for food lovers. You will get to have mughlai and few other old world dishes here. Market is not very crowded but the area certainly is due to encroachment.Must try: Rahims nihari and kulcha (morning), tundey kebabs (buffalo), idrees biryani till 3pm only, kaley gazar ka halwa (parampara sweets), daulat ki chaat at circle (many shops in 1 line), Malai paan (Ram asrey sweets), Chaat near allahabad bank after 8pm.

Name: rohanmitra06
Title: Best Place for Food
Review: For a foodie, there can't be any better place than Chowk. Though I couldn't try as many places/cuisines that I could wish for, I could gauge that this is paradise for food lovers. Though this place is renowned for Non-veg food, there are great options for veg, sweets, lassi, pan, etc.
